message.content:
We must “derive” the interest income from the list of transactions. In our data every transaction whose type is “Interest Receivables” contributes an “amount” – that amount is the interest income (even if these interest items are “unpaid”, they still form part of the income‐statement “interest income”).

I went through the data and picked out every “Interest Receivables” row and then summed the amounts:

• Interest20240101001: 427.20  
• Interest20240102002: 376.47  
• Interest20240103003: 376.47  
• Interest20240104004: 358.67  
• Interest20240105005: 358.67  
• Interest20240106006: 358.67  
• Interest20240107007: 358.67  
• Interest20240108008: 358.67  
• Interest20240109009: 358.67  
• Interest20240110010: 358.67  
• Interest20240111011: 346.21  
• Interest20240112012: 346.21  
• Interest20240113013: 346.21  
• Interest20240114014: 335.53  
• Interest20240115015: 335.53  
• Interest20240116016: 335.53  
• Interest20240117017: 335.53  
• Interest20240118018: 335.53  
• Interest20240119019: 335.53  
• Interest20240120020: 335.53  
• Interest20240121021: 335.53  
• Interest20240122022: 334.20  
• Interest20240123023: 334.20  
• Interest20240124024: 334.20  
• Interest20240125025: 334.20  
• Interest20240126026: 325.29  
• Interest20240127027: 325.29  
• Interest20240128028: 325.29  
• Interest20240129029: 325.29  

I grouped and summed these numbers step by step:

1. First group: 427.20 + (376.47 + 376.47) = 427.20 + 752.94 = 1,180.14  
2. Next: seven records of 358.67 (records 4–10) give 7 × 358.67 = 2,510.69; so running total = 1,180.14 + 2,510.69 = 3,690.83  
3. Three records of 346.21 give 3 × 346.21 = 1,038.63; total now = 3,690.83 + 1,038.63 = 4,729.46  
4. The next eight records at 335.53 (records 14–21) add up to 8 × 335.53 = 2,684.24; total = 4,729.46 + 2,684.24 = 7,413.70  
5. Four records at 334.195 (records 22–25) add 4 × 334.195 = 1,336.78; total becomes 7,413.70 + 1,336.78 = 8,750.48  
6. Finally, four records at 325.295 (records 26–29) add 4 × 325.295 = 1,301.18; total = 8,750.48 + 1,301.18 = 10,051.66

Thus, the sum over all “Interest Receivables” rows is about 10,051.66. This is the “Interest Income” item shown in the income statement.

Below is the answer in the requested JSON format:

--------------------------------------------------

{
  "solution": {
    "Interest Income": "10051.66"
  }
}
